Interface DataSource

public interface DataSource

1.0
Author:
Nic Evans

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes the datasource
 byte[] getData(int length)
          Returns data from the datasource.
 byte[] getData(long pos, int length)
          Do not assume this has no effect on the position - if you need to preserve the location within the datasource then you must first save it and restore when finished.
 long getPosition()
          Gets the position of the filepointer.
 void setPosition(long pos)
          Sets the position of the file pointer.
 

Method Detail

getData

byte[] getData(long pos,
               int length)
               throws java.io.IOException
Do not assume this has no effect on the position - if you need to preserve the location within the datasource then you must first save it and restore when finished.

Parameters:
pos - the position to read data from
length - the amount of data to read (if available)
Returns:
byte[] containing the data requested
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getData

byte[] getData(int length)
               throws java.io.IOException
Returns data from the datasource. Reads from the current file pointer. Note do not assume the file pointer is moved 'n' bytes.

Parameters:
length - the amount of data to read (if available)
Returns:
byte[] containing the data requested
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setPosition

void setPosition(long pos)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Sets the position of the file pointer.

Parameters:
pos - the new position
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getPosition

long getPosition()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Gets the position of the filepointer.

Returns:
the current file pointer position
Throws:
java.io.IOException

close

void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the datasource

Throws:
java.io.IOException
